title: How to Make a Rich Ginger Cake

steps.headline: Melt the butter or margarine, golden syrup and sugar in a saucepan over low heat.
steps.description: Give it a good stir from time to time to mix it properly. Let it cool for about two or three minutes.

steps.headline: Meanwhile mix the flour, baking powder and ground ginger in the mixing bowl.
Now add the pieces of ginger and mix them in well so they're not all stuck together.
Beat the egg and milk together and then stir it into the mixture in the saucepan.
Now pour it all into the mixing bowl, stir it all in and then beat like mad until the mixture is smooth (it will be grainy because of the wholemeal flour - that's fine)
Pour it all into the loaf tin or container.
Leave a little bit in the bowl for eating!

steps.headline: Bake it in oven for about 40 minutes or until it is well risen and coming away slightly from the sides.

text: Preheat your oven to 350ºF / Mark 4 / 180ºC.  Grease your pan.  Melt the butter or margarine, golden syrup and sugar in a saucepan over low heat. Give it a good stir from time to time to mix it properly. Let it cool for about two or three minutes. Meanwhile mix the flour, baking powder and ground ginger in the mixing bowl.  Now add the pieces of ginger and mix them in well so they're not all stuck together.  Beat the egg and milk together and then stir it into the mixture in the saucepan. Give it a good beating! Now pour it all into the mixing bowl, stir it all in and then beat like mad until the mixture is smooth (it will be grainy because of the wholemeal flour - that's fine)  Pour it all into the loaf tin or container.  Leave a little bit in the bowl for eating! One of the best things about baking - running your finger round the bowl and eating raw cake mix .. yum! Bake it in oven for about 40 minutes or until it is well risen and coming away slightly from the sides.  Turn out onto a wire rack and let it cool for a while.
